name: perniciously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that has a very harmful effect or influence: Her family had perniciously neglected her during her later years. The country is governed by a perniciously corrupt group of people.
More examplesFewer examplesWhat started out as a bit of harmless fun has perniciously developed into an obsession.The manufacturer had perniciously made a false claim about the safety of their vehicles.Historians have perniciously disregarded the contribution that this woman made to our understanding of geology.
